name: AddListMemberEvent
description:
Add an event for a list member in Mailchimp.

This tool adds an event to a specific list member in Mailchimp. It should be called when you need to track a specific activity or event for a subscriber in a mailing list.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Mailchimp list.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: list_member_identifier
parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address, or the email address/contact_id.

value_schema.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

parameters.name: event_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing details about the event such as 'name', 'properties', 'is_syncing', and 'occurred_at'.

name.description: The name for this type of event ('purchased', 'visited', etc). Must be 2-30 characters in length

is_syncing.description: Events created with the is_syncing value set to `true` will not trigger automations.

occurred_at.description: The date and time the event occurred in ISO 8601 format.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the list.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: subscriber_hash
parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

value_schema.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

name.description: The name for this type of event ('purchased', 'visited', etc). Must be 2-30 characters in length

is_syncing.description: Events created with the is_syncing value set to `true` will not trigger automations.

occurred_at.description: The date and time the event occurred in ISO 8601 format.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
